title: Inward mail direct into Archive folder
content: My Sky email account was hacked. When I got this secured again I've found that all my inward mail goes straight into my Thunderbird Archive folder rather than the inbox. I've had a look in the settings in my Sky email (Yahoo) but can't find anything. Any ideas?
creator: sdnjgreen

title: Merging Thunderbird environments
content: My old PC collapsed and the new PC refused my Acronis backup (can't find 2 !?). I prepared the new PC for Thunderbird to avoid time loss. I succeeded to restart the old PC, but a session only lasts for about ten minutes, then a blue screen is slowly appearing line by line. This is not enough time to make a new backup, but it allows me to save individual files and folders. I thus exported my Thunderbird environment. Can I merge the exported data (a few K emails) with the new Thunderbird environment (a few hundred emails)? I will be much obliged if you can suggest a solution.
creator: rf.van.zijl

title: The automatic email finder found a defunct address and won't let me change it to an actual email
content:
I didn't realize that Thunderbird was not an actual email rather than a tool to go get emails. So when I signed up, Thunderbird found a defunct email that no longer exists... and it refuses to let me find and change to a new email address. (I was an almost 30 year patron of AOL and they just screwed us over so dawnearle has to find a new email.) How can I change the name and find another email that works?

Humans are far better than automatic programs when it comes to fixing problems!

As long as I still have to use the new crappy AOL for any email I'm dawnearle@ aol.com (you can delete the spaces in a reply)

Thanks for any aid you can offer.
creator: dawnearle

title: I cannot login to my gmail
content:
I tried both imap and pop3, i have 2-fa off, SSL/TS is selected ports are 993 465 Oauth2, after clicking Allow on the oauth2 screen, i just go back to Thunderbird with a yellow message saying an error has ocurred, this is a brand new install i never used thunderbird before.

any ideas on how to fix this?

I already checked on the gmail account and both POP and imap are enabled
creator: leoziinn66
